aboutConversion.editable: The resulting Word document is fully editable in Microsoft Word or other word processors.

aboutConversion.title: About PDF to Image Conversion
aboutConversion.quality: Generate high-quality images that preserve all visual elements of your PDF documents.
aboutConversion.formats: Support for PNG format (lossless, ideal for text and lines) and JPEG format (compressed, ideal for photos).
aboutConversion.resolution: Adjustable resolution to meet different needs - higher for printing, lower for screen viewing.
aboutConversion.local: All conversions are performed locally in your browser. Files are not uploaded to any server, ensuring privacy and security.

privacy.title: Privacy & Security
privacy.description: All PDF processing is done locally in your browser. Your files are never uploaded to any server, ensuring complete privacy and security.

noRegistration.title: No Registration Required
noRegistration.description: Use all our tools without creating an account or providing any personal information.

localProcessing.title: Local Processing
localProcessing.description: All file processing happens directly in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

noStorage.title: No File Storage
noStorage.description: We don't store your files. Once you close the browser tab, all data is automatically cleared.

pdfCompare.howItWorksDescription: This tool uses advanced PDF comparison algorithms to analyze content, layout, and format differences between two PDF files. The system identifies text changes, additions or deletions, as well as image and format changes, and highlights these differences in the comparison result.
pdfCompare.privacyNote: Note: All processing is done in your browser, files are not uploaded to any server, ensuring your data privacy and security.
pdfCompare.comparisonComplete: Comparison complete, please check the results

errors.missingFiles: Please upload two PDF files to compare
errors.comparisonFailed: Comparison failed, please check if the PDF files are valid

guides.pageDescription: Detailed guides on how to use our PDF tools, including steps for stamping, merging, splitting, and compressing PDFs.
guides.subtitle: Learn how to effectively use our PDF tools with these step-by-step guides.
guides.localProcessingDescription: All our PDF tools process your files locally in your browser, without uploading them to any server. This ensures your data privacy and security. No registration required, no waiting for uploads and downloads, and faster processing.

steps.step1: Upload your PDF file by clicking 'Select PDF File'
steps.step2: Upload a stamp image or create a transparent stamp
steps.step3: Adjust stamp size, position, and angle
steps.step4: Select pages to apply the stamp
steps.step5: Click 'Add Stamp' to process your PDF

tips.tip1: Use PNG images with transparency for cleaner stamps
tips.tip2: For non-transparent images, use our 'Make Transparent Stamp' tool
tips.tip3: Recommended stamp size is 30-50mm for most documents

faqs.q1: What file formats are supported for stamps?
faqs.a1: Our tool supports PNG, JPEG, and other common image formats. PNG with transparency works best for stamps with clean backgrounds.
faqs.q2: Is there a file size limit?
faqs.a2: Since all processing is done in your browser, the file size limit depends on your device's memory. Generally, files up to 100MB should work well.

steps.step1: Click 'Add File' to select multiple PDF files
steps.step2: Drag and drop to reorder files as needed

tips.tip1: Ensure all PDFs have similar page sizes for best appearance
tips.tip2: You can merge up to 20 files at once for optimal performance

faqs.q1: Will the merged PDF maintain bookmarks and links?
faqs.a1: Yes, our merge tool preserves most PDF features including bookmarks, links, and form fields from the original documents.
faqs.a2: Currently, our tool doesn't support merging password-protected PDFs. Please remove the password protection before uploading.

steps.step2: Choose between Range Selection or Custom Selection

tips.tip1: Use the preview to confirm page selections before splitting
tips.tip2: For complex splitting, you can add multiple range selections

faqs.q1: Can I split a PDF into individual pages?
faqs.a1: Yes, you can split a PDF into individual pages by creating a separate range for each page or using the custom selection option.

tips.tip1: For documents with mostly text, you can choose higher compression
tips.tip2: For documents with high-quality images, choose medium compression to maintain image quality

faqs.q1: Will compression affect the quality of my PDF?
faqs.a1: Compression will slightly reduce image quality based on the level chosen, but text is usually unaffected. You can choose a compression level that suits your needs.
faqs.q2: Is there a maximum file size limit?
faqs.a2: Since processing happens in the browser, large files may require more time and memory. We recommend files under 100MB.

faq.pageDescription: Find answers to common questions about our free PDF tools, including security, features, and technical support.
faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our PDF tools. If you don't find the information you need, feel free to contact us.
faq.contactUs: If you didn't find the answer you need, feel free to contact us. We're happy to help!

answers.free: Yes, all our PDF tools are completely free to use with no hidden fees or premium features. We believe in providing accessible tools for everyone.
answers.security: Your data is completely secure as all processing happens locally in your browser. Your files are never uploaded to any server, ensuring maximum privacy and security.
answers.mobile: Yes, our tools are designed to work on both desktop and mobile devices. However, for complex operations or large files, we recommend using a desktop for the best experience.
answers.fileSize: Since all processing is done in your browser, limitations depend on your device's capabilities. Generally, files up to 100MB work well, but larger files may require more processing time or memory.

questions.processingTime: How long does it take to process a PDF?
questions.encryptedPdfs: Can I process encrypted or password-protected PDFs?
questions.quality: How is the quality of processed PDFs?
questions.whyBrowser: Why choose browser-based processing instead of server processing?
questions.browsers: What browsers do I need to use these tools?
questions.largeFiles: Why are some large files processed slowly?
questions.issues: What should I do if I encounter issues while using the tools?
